'''Roger Alan Wade''' is an American singer-songwriter from [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]].

==Career==
According to his website, Wade has penned songs for country legends such as [[Johnny Cash]], [[Waylon Jennings]], [[George Jones]], [[Hank Williams, Jr.]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://oglio.com/roger-alan-wade |title=Roger Alan Wade â€“ All Likkered Up | Oglio Entertainment |website=Oglio.com |date=February 16, 2011 |accessdate=March 1, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Dulaney |first=Josh |url= https://www.ocweekly.com/roger-alan-wade-orange-county-hillbillies-know-their-outlaw-music-6569736/ |title=Roger Alan Wade: "Orange County Hillbillies Know Their Outlaw Music" |website= OC Weekly |date=July 2, 2012 |accessdate=March 1, 2017}}</ref> and several others. He embarked on a solo career with the promotional assistance of his cousin, actor [[Johnny Knoxville]],<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.outlawmagazine.tv/content/roger-alan-wade-feature/ |title=Roger Alan Wade: RAW & Real|website=Outlaw Magazine |date=September 29, 2011 |accessdate=March 1, 2017}}</ref> who occasionally featured Wade's music on his TV show ''[[Jackass (franchise)|Jackass]]'', and its subsequent movies.

He was featured on the TV show ''[[Wildboyz]]''.  During an appearance on ''[[The Howard Stern Show]]'', Knoxville promoted Wade's songs, which were favorably received by Stern and his audience and given frequent airplay thereafter.

Wade's lyrics satirically and detrimentally deal with topics and stereotypes relating to [[Redneck (stereotype)|redneck]] and [[honky tonk]] culture. Before nearly every live song, Roger states, "this is a song about a girl".  He co-wrote the hit song "[[Country State of Mind]]" with [[Hank Williams, Jr.]]<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.outlawmagazine.tv/content/brandy-lee-dixon-interviews-roger-alan-wade/ |title=Roger Alan Wade |website=Outlaw Magazine |date=September 27, 2011 |accessdate=March 1, 2017}}</ref>

His songs feature [[folk music|folky]] arrangements, featuring little or no accompaniment beyond [[Steel-string acoustic guitar|acoustic guitar]].  His best known compositions include "BB Gun", "Butt Ugly Slut", "D-R-U-N-K", "Poontang", and "If You're Gonna Be Dumb".  Wade's lesser known works are less hysterical and carry a more lyrical tone including "The First Time I Saw Waylon", "Brainerd Road", and "Jingle Jangle". His song "If You're Gonna Be Dumb You Gotta Be Tough" has appeared in every ''Jackass'' film, with Wade's version on the first film and subsequent films featuring covers of the song by [[Smut Peddlers]], [[Karen O]], [[The Deadly Syndrome]], [[Yelawolf]] and [[DJ Paul]], and [[Starcrawler]]. Wade wrote "The Light Outlives the Star" for a friend of his daughter who died in an automobile accident. It later served as a tribute to his friend and fan, [[Ryan Dunn]], who died in a car accident on June 20, 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.digitalspy.com/showbiz/a328144/jackass-cast-pay-tribute-to-ryan-dunn-video/ |title='Jackass' cast pay tribute to Ryan Dunn |website=Digital Spy |date=July 4, 2011 |access-date=April 5, 2019}}</ref>

Wade has provided voiceover work for [[WUUQ]] 97.3 and 99.3 FM, a classic country station in Chattanooga, Tennessee, as well as classic country formatted [[WBZW|WWLG]] "96.7 The Legend" in Atlanta, Georgia from its launch in late 2007 to around 2009. Since 2008, Knoxville and Wade have hosted an hour-long weekly show, ''Big Ass Happy Family Jubilee'' (named after a Wade song), on [[Sirius XM]]'s [[Outlaw Country (Sirius XM)|Outlaw Country]] channel.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.rogeralanwade.net/bio.html |title=Roger Alan Wade biography |website=Roger Alan Wade's Official Site |access-date=April 5, 2019}}</ref>
